children.value: Gatsby stores all data loaded during the source-nodes phase in Redux. And it allows you to write GraphQL queries to query that data. But Redux is a plain JavaScript object store. So how does Gatsby query over those nodes using the GraphQL query language?
The answer is that it uses the
library. It is a port of the MongoDB query language that works over plain JavaScript objects. It turns out that mongo’s query language is very compatible with GraphQL.

This file converts GraphQL Arguments into sift queries and applies them to the collection of all nodes of this type. The rough steps are:
Convert query args to sift args
Resolve inner query fields on all nodes
Run sift query on all nodes
